name: Biriyani
description: This popular Bangladeshi dish is made with fragrant, long-grain basmati rice, tender meat (usually chicken or beef), and a blend of aromatic spices. The meat is typically marinated in a mixture of yogurt and spices before being cooked with the rice. The dish is usually served with a side of raita (yogurt-based sauce) and fried onions.

name: Pitha
description: Pitha is a type of traditional Bangladeshi cake or pastry, typically made with rice flour and coconut. The dough is shaped into small balls or discs, which are then steamed or fried until they are soft and fluffy. Pitha comes in many different varieties, including sweet and savory versions.

name: Chotpoti
description: Chotpoti is a popular street food in Bangladesh that is made from chickpeas, boiled potatoes, and a blend of spices. The dish is typically served cold, and it is topped with a tangy tamarind sauce and chopped onions. It is often eaten as a snack or light meal, and it is a great way to experience the flavors of Bangladeshi cuisine.
